member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Defines SSPI authentication methods used for logging in the user account on the server.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod.NTLM
member.summary: Secure SASL NTLM authentication (also known as Secure Password Authentication - SPA). In Windows domain environment such as Active Directory, can also be used to authenticate the current Windows user (in this case, the developer should pass a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) as user name and password values). Might not be supported by particular server implementations.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod.Kerberos
member.summary: Secure SASL GSSAPI authentication (Kerberos). Used to authenticate the current Windows user in Windows domain environment such as Active Directory. User name and password values will be ignored and can be left blank or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). Might not be supported by particular server implementations.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod.Negotiate
member.summary: Negotiate authentication.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus
member.summary: Defines the certificate verification status.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.TimeNotValid
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is not valid due to an invalid time value, such as a value that indicates an expired certificate.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.TimeNotNested
member.summary: Deprecated. Specifies that the CA (certificate authority) certificate and the issued certificate have validity periods that are not nested. For example, the CA cert can be valid from January 1 to December 1 and the issued certificate from January 2 to December 2, which would mean the validity periods are not nested.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.Revoked
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid due to a revoked certificate.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.SignatureNotValid
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid due to an invalid certificate signature.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UsageNotValid
member.summary: Specifies that the key usage is not valid.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UntrustedRoot
member.summary: The certificate or certificate chain is based on an untrusted root.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.RevocationStatusUnknown
member.summary: The revocation status of the certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is unknown.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.Cyclic
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain could not be built.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidExtension
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid due to an invalid extension.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidPolicyConstraints
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid due to invalid policy constraints.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidBasicConstraints
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid due to invalid basic constraints.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidNameConstraints
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid due to invalid name constraints.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotSupportedNameConstraint
member.summary: Specifies that the certificate does not have a supported name constraint or has a name constraint that is unsupported.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotDefinedNameConstraint
member.summary: Specifies that the certificate has an undefined name constraint.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotPermittedNameConstraint
member.summary: Specifies that the certificate has an impermissible name constraint.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.ExcludedNameConstraint
member.summary: Specifies that the X509 chain is invalid because a certificate has excluded a name constraint.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.IncompleteChain
member.summary: The X509 certificate chain is not compete.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CtlTimeNotValid
member.summary: Specifies that the certificate trust list (CTL) is not valid because of an invalid time value, such as one that indicates that the CTL has expired.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CtlSignatureNotValid
member.summary: Specifies that the certificate trust list (CTL) contains an invalid signature.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CtlUsageNotValid
member.summary: Specifies that the certificate trust list (CTL) is not valid for this use.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.OfflineRevocation
member.summary: Specifies that the online certificate revocation list (CRL) the X509 chain relies on is currently offline.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NoIssuanceChainPolicy
member.summary: Specifies that there is no certificate policy extension in the certificate. This error would occur if a group policy has specified that all certificates must have a certificate policy.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotSupportedSignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: Not supported signature algorithm
Unsupported signature algorithm.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UnknownError
member.summary: Unknown error.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.PathTooLong
member.summary: A path length constraint is violated.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UnknownCriticalExtension
member.summary: A certificate contains an unknown extension that is marked critical.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidChain
member.summary: A parent of a given certificate in fact did not issue that child certificate.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UnknownCa
member.summary: A certificate chain could not be built to a trusted root authority.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CnNotMatch
member.summary: The certificate's CN name does not match the passed value.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CaNotTrusted
member.summary: A certification chain processed correctly, but one of the CA certificates is not trusted by the policy provider.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.ExplicitDistrust
member.summary: The certificate was explicitly marked as untrusted by the user.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.Malformed
member.summary: A certificate is missing or has an empty value for an important field, such as a subject or issuer name.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.HasMoreErrors
member.summary: There might be more errors.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.WeakAlgorithm
member.summary: The algorithm used in the certificate is not considered secure on this platform.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotTrusted
member.summary: Certificate is not trusted.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags
member.summary: Represents the different verification flags used to verify a server's certificate.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.None
member.summary: No options specified.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreTimeNotValid
member.summary: Ignore certificates in the chain that are not valid either because they have expired or they are not yet in effect when determining certificate validity.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreCtlTimeNotValid
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate trust list (CTL) is not valid, for reasons such as the CTL has expired, when determining certificate verification.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreTimeNotNested
member.summary: Ignore that the CA (certificate authority) certificate and the issued certificate have validity periods that are not nested when verifying the certificate. For example, the CA cert can be valid from January 1 to December 1 and the issued certificate from January 2 to December 2, which would mean the validity periods are not nested.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreAllTimeNotValid
member.summary: Ignore certificates in the chain that have any invalid time checks.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreInvalidBasicConstraints
member.summary: Ignore that the basic constraints are not valid when determining certificate verification.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.AllowUnknownCa
member.summary: Ignore that the chain cannot be verified due to an unknown certificate authority (CA).

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreWrongUsage
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate was not issued for the current use when determining certificate verification.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreInvalidPolicy
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate has invalid policy when determining certificate verification.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreEndRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore that the end certificate (the user certificate) revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreCtlSignerRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate signer revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreCaRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate authority revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreRootRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore that the root revocation is unknown when determining certificate verification.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreAllRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate revocation status is unknown when determining certificate verification.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.AllowTestRoot
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.TrustTestRoot
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.UseCacheOnly
member.summary: Use local cache only.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.IgnoreCnNotMatch
member.summary: Ignore that the certificate common name is invalid when determining certificate verification.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.VerificationFlags.SkipRevocationCheck
member.summary: Skip certificate revocation check.
member.remarks: Not supported in builds for .NET CF.

member.name: T:c_UXA
member.summary: Managed implementation of DSA signature algorithm.

remarks.p: The purpose of this class is to make it possible to verify signatures without the need to use CryptoAPI, which is not available in some scenarios.
Even though it is possible to generate DSA keys and sign data using this class, but this process has not been optimized for speed and is very slow.

member.name: T:c_PLB
member.summary: Computes a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) for the input data using the specified hash function.
member.remarks:
HMAC is defined by RFC 2104 and look like this: alg(K XOR opad + alg(K XOR ipad + text))
where alg is the base hash algorithm,
K is an n byte key,
ipad is the byte 0x36 repeated 64 times (or 128 times),
opad is the byte 0x5c repeated 64 times (or 128 times),
and text is the data being protected.

member.param: A type of hash algorithm to use. Must be a subclass of HashAlgorithm.

member.name: T:c_RXA
member.summary: Managed implementation of RSA algorithm.
member.p: The purpose of this class is to make it possible to verify signatures and encrypt data without the need to use CryptoAPI, which is not available in some scenarios.
Even though it is possible to generate RSA keys and sign data using this class, it is not recommended because the generated keys are not being checked to ensure they are strong primes.

member.summary: Implementation of IDisposable.Dispose()

member.name: M:c_BTC.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If true, is called by IDisposable.Dispose. Otherwise it is called by finalizer.

member.name: T:c_CBD
member.summary: When a client first connects to a server it is required to send the client hello as its first message. The client can also send a client hello in response to a hello request or on its own initiative in order to renegotiate the security parameters in an existing connection.

member.name: T:c_YBD
member.summary: This message is always sent by the client. It will immediately follow the client certificate message, if it is sent. Otherwise it will be the first message sent by the client after it receives the server hello done message.

member.name: T:c_HED
member.summary: A finished message is always sent immediately after a change cipher spec message to verify that the key exchange and authentication processes were successful. It is essential that a change cipher spec message be received between the other handshake messages and the Finished message.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request for a connection to a network device.

The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous connection.
member.remarks: The Connect method establishes a network connection to a host identified by the remoteEP parameter. Once the connection has been made, you can send data to the remote device with the Send method, or receive data from the remote device with the Receive method.

member.returns: An that references the asynchronous connection.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.ISocket.BeginListen(ComponentPro.Net.ISocket,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronously request to listen for an incoming connection using the specified control socket as a base.
member.param: The control socket to use as a base.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous request.

remarks.p:
This method differs from :
A control connection socket needs to be specified. This might be needed by a proxy server socket.
Only a single incoming connection is accepted.
To accept an incoming connection, use the or method.
Note: When connected through a HTTP proxy server, this method will fail.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.ISocket.BeginReceive(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.SocketFlags,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins to asynchronously receive data from the connected .
member.param: The storage location for the received data.
The position in the buffer at which to store the received data.
The number of bytes to receive.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous read.

remarks.p: Prior to receiving data, the socket must be connected using either a call to method or a call to and methods.

The BeginReceive method starts asynchronously reading data from the ISocket. You should create a callback method that implements the AsyncCallback delegate. This callback method should use the EndSend method to complete the asynchronous operation. See the .NET Framework SDK Reference for more information on asynchronous methods.

remarks.p: Prior to sending data, the socket must be connected using either a call to method or a call to and methods.

The BeginSend method starts asynchronously sending data through the ISocket. You should create a callback method that implements the AsyncCallback delegate. This callback method should use the EndSend method to complete the asynchronous operation. See the .NET Framework SDK Reference for more information on asynchronous methods.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.ISocket.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out which is default).

The property only affects synchronous methods.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.NetClient.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.ProxySocket
member.summary: Implements the subset of the Berkeley sockets interface (or the class) and adds the ability to connect through Socks4/Socks5 or HTTP proxies.

remarks.p: This class is suitable for extending your client applications with the ability to connect through proxies.
This class is limited to operations supported by proxies - it is not a replacement for the . This means it is perfect for writing clients, but useless for writing servers.
Only connection-oriented protocols are supported at the moment

member.returns: An that references the asynchronous connection.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.ProxySocket.BeginListen(ComponentPro.Net.ISocket,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronously request to listen for an incoming connection using the specified control socket as a base.
member.param: The control socket to use as a base.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous request.

remarks.p:
This method differs from :
A control connection socket needs to be specified. This might be needed by a proxy server socket.
Only a single incoming connection is accepted.
To accept an incoming connection, use the or method.
Note: When connected through a HTTP proxy server, this method will fail.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.ProxySocket.BeginReceive(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.SocketFlags,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins to asynchronously receive data from a connected .
member.param: The storage location for the received data.
The position in the buffer at which to store the received data.
The number of bytes to receive.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous read.

remarks.p: Prior to receiving data, the socket must be connected using either a call to method or a call to and methods.

The BeginReceive method starts asynchronously reading data from a ProxySocket. You should create a callback method that implements the AsyncCallback delegate. This callback method should use the EndReceive method to complete the asynchronous operation. See the .NET Framework SDK Reference for more information on asynchronous methods.

The position in the data buffer to begin sending data.
The number of bytes to send.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.

remarks.p: Prior to sending data, the socket must be connected using either a call to method or a call to and methods.

The BeginSend method starts asynchronously sending data through a ProxySocket. You should create a callback method that implements the AsyncCallback delegate. This callback method should use the EndSend method to complete the asynchronous operation. See the .NET Framework SDK Reference for more information on asynchronous methods.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.ProxySocket.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out which is default).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1 (infinite).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property only affects synchronous methods.
Minimal value is 500. Setting this to a value lower than 500 will set it to 500.

member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the proxy host name.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is authenticated.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellConnection.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellConnection.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellConnection.InvokeFromCurrentThreads
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to raise events from the current thread or to use a object available when an asynchronous operation was started. The default value is false.
member.value: true to raise events directly from the current working thread; false to raise them using a object.
member.remarks: Synchronous methods always raise events from the current working thread.

The algorithm to use for encryption. Ignored if password is null. Null defaults to "3DES".
member.remarks:
The encryptionAlgorithm can accepts a String or a Type. Currently, the following strings and types are accepted:
TripleDES: null, "3DES", "TripleDES", "1.2.840.113549.3.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES)
DES: "DES", "1.3.14.3.2.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.DES)
RC2: "RC2", "1.2.840.113549.3.2", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.RC2)
To save the key in PuTTY format, pass the "putty" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.
To save the key on OpenSSH/OpenSSL SSLeay format, pass the "ssleay" or "openssh" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellPrivateKey.Save(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves the private key into the specified file in Base64-encoded PKCS #8 format.
member.param: A path to stream to which to save the private key.
Password to encrypted the private key, or null if no encryption desired.
The algorithm to use for encryption. Ignored if password is null. Null defaults to "3DES".
member.remarks:
The encryptionAlgorithm can accepts a String or a Type. Currently, the following strings and types are accepted:
TripleDES: null, "3DES", "TripleDES", "1.2.840.113549.3.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES)
DES: "DES", "1.3.14.3.2.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.DES)
RC2: "RC2", "1.2.840.113549.3.2", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.RC2)
To save the key in PuTTY format, pass the "putty" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.
To save the key on OpenSSH/OpenSSL SSLeay format, pass the "ssleay" or "openssh" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.

member.name: T:c_XED
member.summary: The server will send this message in response to a client hello message when it was able to find an acceptable set of algorithms. If it cannot find such a match, it will respond with a handshake failure alert.

member.name: T:c_AFD
member.summary: The server hello done message is sent by the server to indicate the end of the server hello and associated messages. After sending this message the server will wait for a client response.

summary.p: This message will be sent immediately after the server certificate message (or the server hello message, if this is an anonymous negotiation).
The server key exchange message is sent by the server only when the server certificate message (if sent) does not contain enough data to allow the client to exchange a premaster secret.

member.summary: Gets or sets the client certificate request handler.

remarks.p: This is only used by client sockets.
When a server requests a client to send a certificate, this will be used to select the appropriate client certificate.
Default value is . You might want to use if client authentication is needed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed protocol versions.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.CacheSessions
member.summary: Indicates whether to cache sessions. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Mostly useful for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.StayConnected
member.summary: Indicates whether or not shutdown and close the underlying socket after sending or receiving fatal alert or close notify. The default value is true - stay connected.
member.value: true to stay connected - dont shutdown and close the underlying socket after sending or receiving fatal alert or close notify; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.InsertEmptyFragment
member.summary: Indicates whether to send empty record after sucessful handshake with CBC ciphers. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.SkipRollbackDetection
member.summary: Indicates whether to ignore the client version in premaster secret. This only affects server sockets. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.SilentUnprotect
member.summary: Indicates whether to force the Unprotection process to do immediate unprotect without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers need it, unfortunately. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.AllowCloseWhileNegotiating
member.summary: Indicates whether to allow socket closure while negotiating. The default value is false.
member.remark: This is needed by Serv-U FTP server that behaves like this when downloading an empty file or directory listing. Even though this behavior is almost certainly bad and could pose a potential security threat, we have to enable this option for this server to be able to work with it.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SslConfigBase.SilentClose
member.summary: Forces the TLS socket to immediately close without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers (IIS with TLS 1.1) need it, unfortunately. The default value is false.

member.summary: No key exchange.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.TlsKeyExchangeAlgorithm.RSA
member.summary: The key exchange works by encrypting a random value (chosen by the client) with the server public key. This requires that the server public key is an RSA key, and that the server certificate does not prohibit encryption.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.TlsKeyExchangeAlgorithm.DHE_RSA
member.summary: RSA signature, the key exchange is an ephemeral Diffie-Hellman

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.TlsKeyExchangeAlgorithm.DHE_DSS
member.summary: DSS signature, the key exchange is an ephemeral Diffie-Hellman

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.TlsKeyExchangeAlgorithm.DH_anon
member.summary: The server uses a Diffie-Hellman key that it may have dynamically generated. The "anon" cipher suites are vulnerable to impersonating attacks (including, but not limited to, the "Man in the Middle") since they lack any kind of server authentication.

member.name: T:c_TFE
member.summary: Specifies secure connection options.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_K2
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_NOE
member.summary: Do not cache any sessions.
member.remarks: Mostly useful for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_LQE
member.summary: This option is no longer supported.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_MOE
member.summary: Do not send empty record after successful handshake with CBC ciphers.
member.remarks: For compatibility with broken implementations.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_LOE
member.summary: Ignore the client version in premaster secret. This only affects server sockets.
member.remarks: For compatibility with broken client implementations.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_THE
member.summary: Forces the method to do immediate unprotect without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers need it, unfortunately.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_S7D
member.summary: This option is currently unused.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_DHE
member.summary: Causes an exception not to be thrown when a socket is closed by the server during negotiation. Instead, the negotiation will appear as successful, followed by an immediate socket closure.
member.remarks: This is needed by Serv-U FTP server that behaves like this when downloading an empty file or directory listing. Even though this behavior is almost certainly bad and could pose a potential security threat, we have to enable this option for this server to be able to work with it.

member.name: F:c_TFE.c_BHE
member.summary: Forces the method to do immediate close without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers (IIS with TLS 1.1) need it, unfortunately.

member.name: M:c_B7C.BeginListen(ComponentPro.Net.ISocket,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronously request to listen for an incoming connection using the specified control socket as a base.
member.param: The control socket to use as a base.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous request.

remarks.p:
This method differs from :
A control connection socket needs to be specified. This might be needed by a proxy server socket.
Only a single incoming connection is accepted.
To accept an incoming connection, use the or method.
Note: When connected through a HTTP proxy server, this method will fail.

member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous read.
member.param: The storage location for the received data.
The position in the buffer at which to store the received data.
The number of bytes to receive.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous send.
member.remarks: The EndReceive method completes a request to accept a connection that was started with the method.

member.name: M:c_B7C.BeginSend(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.SocketFlags,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Sends data asynchronously to a connected .
member.param: The data to be sent.
The position in the data buffer to begin sending data.
The number of bytes to send.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous send.

remarks.p: Prior to sending data, the socket must be connected using either a call to method or a call to and methods.

The BeginSend method starts asynchronously sending data through the ISocket. You should create a callback method that implements the AsyncCallback delegate. This callback method should use the EndSend method to complete the asynchronous operation. See the .NET Framework SDK Reference for more information on asynchronous methods.

member.name: M:c_B7C.Close

member.name: P:c_B7C.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out.
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1 (infinite).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property only affects synchronous methods.
Minimal value is 500. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.param: digest property.

member.name: M:c_MLD.c_PXE(System.String)
member.summary: Username and password encoding, as specified by RFC 2831: Even if "charset=UTF-8" is present, if all the characters are in the ISO 8859-1 character set, then the value must be converted to ISO 8859-1 before being hashed.

member.name: M:c_MLD.c_LXE
member.summary: Selects the best "quality of protection" from the list sent by server.

member.name: M:c_MLD.c_JXE(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Casts bytes to characters without changing their numerical values.
member.remarks: Encoding.GetString gives the same results as this method for ASCII data, but not in general (i.e. Windows 1250 converts byte 135 into character 8825).

member.name: F:c_MLD.c_BYE
member.summary: Client string unique for each response.

member.name: F:c_MLD.c_YXE
member.summary:
Description of digest algorithm:
digest-challenge = 1#( realm | nonce | qop-options | stale | maxbuf | charset algorithm | cipher-opts | auth-param ) realm = "realm" "=" " realm-value " realm-value = qdstr-val nonce = "nonce" "=" "nonce-value " nonce-value = qdstr-val qop-options = "qop" "=" " qop-list " qop-list = 1#qop-value qop-value = "auth" | "auth-int" | "auth-conf" | token stale = "stale" "=" "true" maxbuf = "maxbuf" "=" maxbuf-value maxbuf-value = 1*DIGIT charset = "charset" "=" "utf-8" algorithm = "algorithm" "=" "md5-sess" cipher-opts = "cipher" "=" "1#cipher-value" cipher-value = "3des" | "des" | "rc4-40" | "rc4" | "rc4-56" | token auth-param = token "=" ( token | quoted-string )

member.name: F:c_MLD.c_ZXE
member.summary: Array after parsing digest challenge from server.

member.name: F:c_MLD.c_CYE
member.summary: Response value from server after send client authentication string.

member.name: F:c_MLD.c_AYE
member.summary: Digest-uri value imap/servername.com.

member.name: T:c_TZE
member.summary: The ways DIGEST-MD5 can fail (currently just one).

member.name: F:c_TZE.c_UXE
member.summary: Authentication data doesn't fit into Latin 1, but server doesn't support any other charset.

member.name: F:c_TZE.c_VXE
member.summary: Server offers no recognizable quality of protection values.

member.name: T:c_OQE
member.summary: MAC for SSL3 records and SSL3 Finished message
member.remarks:
The MAC is generated as: alg(K + pad_2 + alg(text + K + pad_1)) // Handshake Finished message MAC alg(K + pad_2 + alg(K + pad_1 + text)) // Record MAC where K is an n byte key
pad_1 is the character 0x36 repeated 48 times for MD5 or 40 times for SHA pad_2 is the character 0x5c repeated 48 times for MD5 or 40 times for SHA and text is the data being protected

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.ProxyClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out which is default).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1 (infinite).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property only affects synchronous methods.
Minimal value is 500. Setting this to a value lower than 500 will set it to 500.
